title: Problem Overview: DISPROVED
content:
Erdős Problem #230 asked: for unimodular P(z) = Σ a_k z^k with |a_k| = 1, does max_{|z|=1} |P(z)| ≥ (1+c)√n for some universal c > 0?

**ANSWER: NO** (Kahane 1980)

**Key insight:** 'Ultraflat' polynomials exist where max |P(z)| = (1+o(1))√n, arbitrarily close to the Parseval lower bound √n.

This was a surprising disproof of Erdős's original conjecture.

title: Unimodular Polynomial
content:
**UnimodularPolynomial:**

A polynomial P(z) = Σ a_k z^k where every coefficient a_k lies on the unit circle: |a_k| = 1.

**Examples:** Random phases e^{iθ_k}, or ±1 (Littlewood polynomials).

The constraint |a_k| = 1 makes this a natural class to study.

title: Sup Norm on Unit Circle
content:
**supNormOnCircle:**

‖P‖_∞ = max_{|z|=1} |P(z)|

This is what we want to bound below. The question is: how close can it get to √n?

title: Parseval's Identity
content:
**parseval_identity:**

For unimodular P of degree n:
‖P‖_2² = Σ |a_k|² = n

So ‖P‖_2 = √n exactly. This gives the trivial lower bound ‖P‖_∞ ≥ √n.

title: The False Conjecture
content:
**ErdosNewmanConjecture:**

∃ c > 0 such that ∀ unimodular P: ‖P‖_∞ ≥ (1+c)√n

Erdős and Newman conjectured this in 1957/1961. They believed the sup norm must be bounded away from √n.

**This is FALSE** - Kahane showed ultraflat polynomials exist.

title: Ultraflat Polynomial
content:
**IsUltraflat:**

A polynomial is ε-ultraflat if:
(1-ε)√n ≤ |P(z)| ≤ (1+ε)√n

for ALL |z| = 1. This means |P(z)| is nearly constant on the unit circle!

'Ultra' flat because the ratio max/min → 1 as n → ∞.

title: Kahane's Theorem (1980)
content:
**kahane_ultraflat:**

For any ε > 0 and large enough n, there exists an ε-ultraflat unimodular polynomial of degree n.

This is the key result that DISPROVES the Erdős-Newman conjecture. Ultraflat polynomials have sup norm approaching √n.

title: Kahane Disproves Conjecture
content:
**kahane_disproves:**

¬ErdosNewmanConjecture

**Proof idea:** Given any c > 0, take ε = c/2 and use Kahane to get an ultraflat P with ‖P‖_∞ ≤ (1 + c/2)√n. This contradicts the conjecture which requires ‖P‖_∞ ≥ (1+c)√n.

title: Körner's Construction
content:
**korner_bounded:**

Körner (1980) constructed unimodular polynomials with:
c₁√n ≤ |P(z)| ≤ c₂√n

This showed bounded ratios were possible, a step toward ultraflat.

title: Bombieri-Bourgain (2009)
content:
**bombieri_bourgain:**

Improved Kahane's construction:
|P(z)| = √n + O(n^{7/18} (log n)^{O(1)})

The error exponent 7/18 ≈ 0.389 is the current best. Whether O(1) error is achievable is unknown.

title: Rudin-Shapiro Polynomials
content:
**rudin_shapiro:**

A deterministic family with |P(z)| ≤ 2√n.

These aren't ultraflat (min can be small), but give sup norm control. They're a classical construction in harmonic analysis.

title: Summary: DISPROVED
content:
**erdos_230_summary:**

Erdős Problem #230 is **SOLVED (DISPROVED)**.

**Question:** Does ‖P‖_∞ ≥ (1+c)√n for some c > 0?
**Answer:** NO (Kahane 1980)

**What we know:**
1. Lower bound √n is tight (Parseval)
2. Kahane: Ultraflat polynomials exist
3. Bombieri-Bourgain: Error O(n^{7/18})

**Open:** Can error be O(1)?
